meta_description_localized.en: From street art-esque bars to chic, contemporary dining rooms, we’ve rounded up our favorite places in Miami to get a culture fix with a side of delicious grub. These eateries are as pleasing to the eye as they are to the palate. Here are 5 must-see Miami dining art collections.

post_excerpt_localized.en: From street art-esque bars to chic, contemporary dining rooms, we’ve rounded up our favorite places in Miami to get a culture fix with a side of delicious grub. These eateries are as pleasing to the eye as they are to the palate. Here are 5 must-see Miami dining art collections.

post_content_localized.en:
From street art-esque bars to chic, contemporary dining rooms, we’ve rounded up our favorite places in Miami to get a culture fix with a side of delicious grub. These eateries are as pleasing to the eye as they are to the palate. Here are 5 must-see Miami dining art collections.

Wynwood Kitchen & Bar

For a trendy indoor/outdoor space with tasty tapas, visit one of the “coolest and visually striking restaurants in the nation.” Adjacent to the Wynwood Walls, Wynwood Bar & Kitchen is as colorful inside as the murals just outside its doors. Dine amongst floor-to-ceiling murals by Shepard Fairey and canvasses by German artist, Christian Awe. Mix and match savory global-Latino small plates. Try the rock shrimp ceviche and the yellow tail with crispy quinoa, blood oranges, and sesame. 2550 NW 2nd Ave, Miami

R House

At R House in Wynwood, the cuisine is as creative as the artworks adorning its walls. ​The art gallery eatery serves up globally-inspired eats and infusion cocktails. Order the R House Mule with strawberry infused Absolut vodka, homemade ginger beer, light lime juice, and muddled strawberry. Swing by this hip eatery for live djs, themed parties, and the “Best Drag Brunch in Town” every Saturday and Sunday. 2727 NW 2nd Ave, Miami

Crazy About You

Visit Crazy About You for an elegant evening on Biscayne Bay’s waterfront. The chic bistro has an interior reminiscent of a contemporary art museum, with edgy, political art and whimsical sculptures. Have a seat on their terrace for picturesque bay views and American fusion cuisine at this Brickell destination. 1155 Brickell Bay Dr #101, Miami

Verde

After a day exploring Pérez Art Museum Miami, step inside their on-site Verde restaurant for locally-inspired, seasonal dishes. The views of Biscayne Bay, cool bay breeze, and lush hanging gardens set the scene for a peaceful meal amongst world-renowned contemporary art. Split the Spicy Verde Margarita pitcher with friends. The ancho reyes verde poblano liqueur, lime, and agave cocktail is perfect for lounging bayside. 1103 Biscayne Blvd, Miami

Canvas

Experience culinary art at the Sagamore Hotel in Miami Beach. Chef Michael Smerda welcomes guests to Sagamore’s signature restaurant Canvas, for exquisite multicultural dishes to excite the senses and invigorate the mind. Are you ready for dinner with a side of art? When you book your South Beach stay with Sagamore Hotel, enjoy exclusive access to our curated contemporary art exhibitions, lush outdoor oasis, and sculpture garden.

Now through June 30th, join Sagamore, BelAir Fine Art, and Markowicz Fine Art galleries as we present Music is Life, an exhibit featuring over 100 artworks entirely dedicated to music by international and local artists. Share a photo of your favorite work of art at #SagamoreIsArt and stay up-to-date with us by following the Sagamore Instagram and Facebook for artsy inspiration, latest acquisitions, specials, and happenings at Sagamore.

Choose from our best rates and special offers when you book direct with the Sagamore Hotel, an iconic Miami Beach destination known for its unique collection of contemporary art, spacious suites, and prime location only steps from the white sands of South Beach.
